intro: Corunastylis rufa, commonly known as the red-stemmed star sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wet or seasonally wet habitats, such as swampy areas or along waterways. Corunastylis rufa is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to brackish or saline conditions.
